children.name: li
children: Send webhook notifications without confidential data

children.name: li
children: Can reduce request traffic with bulk operations

children.name: li
children: Webhook consumers must reach provider to gather information

children.name: li
children: Webhook consumers must have API keys to call the provider

content.name: p
children: Microsoft OneNote uses webhooks only to signal that an event has happened. The webhook payload carries only minimal data — event id, expiration date, resource, and state — without confidential details, reducing the risk of data breaches:

content.name: p
children: Upon receiving a webhook notification, consuming apps make a request to the provider to gather more details about the event.

content.name: p
children: While this technique helps reduce webhook security requirements, it requires webhook consumers to make proprietary API calls to the webhook provider to gather details.
This adds implementation complexity for the webhook consumer and operational complexity with distributing API keys, handling REST API performance, and rate limits.

frontmatter.title: Dataless notifications
frontmatter.description: Learn how webhook providers like Microsoft OneNote send webhooks notifications without passing confidential data and the trade-offs with this approach.
